meanings.sent1: The impelling force of the wind pushed the sailboat forward.
meanings.sent2: The impelling music made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent3: The impelling sunshine beckoned people to go outside and enjoy the day.
meanings.sent4: Her impelling determination carried her through the difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The impelling waterfall cascaded down the rocks with great force.

meanings.sent1: The impelling of the train whistle signaled the departure.
meanings.sent2: His impelling of the crowd led to a peaceful protest.
meanings.sent3: The impelling of the bell caused everyone to rush to their seats.
meanings.sent4: The impelling of the waves against the shore created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The impelling of the clock's hands marked the passing of time.

meanings.definition: Causing someone to feel a strong urge or desire
meanings.sent1: The impelling aroma of freshly baked bread made everyone hungry.
meanings.sent2: Her impelling smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent3: The impelling story captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent4: The impelling advertisement convinced many to try the new product.
meanings.sent5: The impelling sight of the sunset left everyone in awe.
